New Records: The Cavaliers became the sixth team in NBA history to start a season 13-0.
The Cavaliers became the first team since the 2015-16 Golden State Warriors to win 13 straight to begin a season.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 11 of his 23 points in the final three minutes of the game.
Mitchell hit three 3-pointers with less than three minutes to play to extend Cleveland's lead to seven.
Pre-Game Insights: The best news of the day for the Sixers came pre-game when both George and Embiid were cleared to play on Friday night in Orlando.
Post-Match Reflections: Head coach Nick Nurse said Georgeâ€™s minutes restriction would be lifted.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers have won 13 in a row for the fourth time in franchise history.
Others: Jared McCain had a career-high 34 for the 76ers, who played without Paul George and Joel Embiid on the second night of a back-to-back as part of left knee injury maintenance.
